alert.note: Alert for Dearborn; Ohio; Ripley; Switzerland (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 21 at 3:27AM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. 1 to 2 inches of rainfall with locally higher amounts will be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Southeast Indiana, Kentucky and Ohio, including the following counties, in Southeast Indiana, Dearborn, Ohio, Ripley and Switzerland. In Kentucky, Boone, Bracken, Campbell, Carroll, Gallatin, Grant, Kenton, Lewis, Mason, Owen, Pendleton and Robertson. In Ohio, Adams, Brown, Clermont, Clinton, Fairfield, Fayette OH, Franklin OH, Hamilton, Highland, Hocking, Licking, Madison, Pickaway, Pike, Ross, Scioto and Warren. * WHEN...From late tonight through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations.
info.instruction: People in the watch area, especially those living in areas prone to flooding, should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Monitor the latest forecasts and be alert for possible flood warnings.
